00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_SEC
00044 
00045 #include <linux/user_namespace.h>
00046 #ifdef HAVE_UIDGID_HEADER
00047 # include <linux/uidgid.h>

00053 
00054 #define lustre_get_group_info(group_info) do {          \
00055         atomic_inc(&(group_info)->usage);               \
00056 } while (0)
00057 
00058 #define lustre_put_group_info(group_info) do {          \
00059         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&(group_info)->usage))  \
00060                 groups_free(group_info);                \
00061 } while (0)
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * groups_search() is copied from linux kernel!
00065  * A simple bsearch.
00066  */
00067 static int lustre_groups_search(struct group_info *group_info,
00068                                 gid_t grp)
00069 {
00070         int left, right;
00071 
00072         if (!group_info)
00073                 return 0;
00074 
00075         left = 0;
00076         right = group_info->ngroups;
00077         while (left < right) {
00078                 int mid = (left + right) / 2;
00079                 int cmp = grp -
00080                         from_kgid(&init_user_ns, CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, mid));
00081 
00082                 if (cmp > 0)
00083                         left = mid + 1;
00084                 else if (cmp < 0)
00085                         right = mid;
00086                 else
00087                         return 1;
00088         }
00089         return 0;
00090 }
00091 
00092 void lustre_groups_from_list(struct group_info *ginfo, gid_t *glist)
00093 {
00094         int i;
00095         int count = ginfo->ngroups;
00096 
00097         /* fill group_info from gid array */
00098         for (i = 0; i < ginfo->nblocks && count > 0; i++) {
00099                 int cp_count = min(CFS_NGROUPS_PER_BLOCK, count);
00100                 int off = i * CFS_NGROUPS_PER_BLOCK;
00101                 int len = cp_count * sizeof(*glist);
00102 
00103                 memcpy(ginfo->blocks[i], glist + off, len);
00104                 count -= cp_count;
00105         }
00106 }
00107 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_groups_from_list);
00108 
00109 /* groups_sort() is copied from linux kernel! */
00110 /* a simple shell-metzner sort */
00111 void lustre_groups_sort(struct group_info *group_info)
00112 {
00113         int base, max, stride;
00114         int gidsetsize = group_info->ngroups;
00115 
00116         for (stride = 1; stride < gidsetsize; stride = 3 * stride + 1)
00117                 ; /* nothing */
00118         stride /= 3;
00119 
00120         while (stride) {
00121                 max = gidsetsize - stride;
00122                 for (base = 0; base < max; base++) {
00123                         int left = base;
00124                         int right = left + stride;
00125                         gid_t tmp = from_kgid(&init_user_ns,
00126                                               CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, right));
00127 
00128                         while (left >= 0 &&
00129                                tmp < from_kgid(&init_user_ns,
00130                                                CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, left))) {
00131                                 CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, right) =
00132                                         CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, left);
00133                                 right = left;
00134                                 left -= stride;
00135                         }
00136                         CFS_GROUP_AT(group_info, right) =
00137                                                 make_kgid(&init_user_ns, tmp);
00138                 }
00139                 stride /= 3;
00140         }
00141 }
00142 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_groups_sort);
00143 
00144 int lustre_in_group_p(struct lu_ucred *mu, gid_t grp)
00145 {
00146         int rc = 1;
00147 
00148         if (grp != mu->uc_fsgid) {
00149                 struct group_info *group_info = NULL;
00150 
00151                 if (mu->uc_ginfo || !mu->uc_identity ||
00152                     mu->uc_valid == UCRED_OLD)
00153                         if (grp == mu->uc_suppgids[0] ||
00154                             grp == mu->uc_suppgids[1])
00155                                 return 1;
00156 
00157                 if (mu->uc_ginfo)
00158                         group_info = mu->uc_ginfo;
00159                 else if (mu->uc_identity)
00160                         group_info = mu->uc_identity->mi_ginfo;
00161 
00162                 if (!group_info)
00163                         return 0;
00164 
00165                 lustre_get_group_info(group_info);
00166                 rc = lustre_groups_search(group_info, grp);
00167                 lustre_put_group_info(group_info);
00168         }
00169         return rc;
00170 }
00171 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_in_group_p);
00172 
00173 struct lustre_idmap_entry {
00174         struct list_head       lie_rmt_uid_hash; /* hashed as lie_rmt_uid; */
00175         struct list_head       lie_lcl_uid_hash; /* hashed as lie_lcl_uid; */
00176         struct list_head       lie_rmt_gid_hash; /* hashed as lie_rmt_gid; */
00177         struct list_head       lie_lcl_gid_hash; /* hashed as lie_lcl_gid; */
00178         uid_t            lie_rmt_uid;      /* remote uid */
00179         uid_t            lie_lcl_uid;      /* local uid */
00180         gid_t            lie_rmt_gid;      /* remote gid */
00181         gid_t            lie_lcl_gid;      /* local gid */
00182 };
00183 
00184 static inline __u32 lustre_idmap_hashfunc(__u32 id)
00185 {
00186         return id & (CFS_IDMAP_HASHSIZE - 1);
00187 }
00188 
00189 static
00190 struct lustre_idmap_entry *idmap_entry_alloc(uid_t rmt_uid, uid_t lcl_uid,
00191                                              gid_t rmt_gid, gid_t lcl_gid)
00192 {
00193         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00194 
00195         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(e);
00196         if (e == NULL)
00197                 return NULL;
00198 
00199         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&e->lie_rmt_uid_hash);
00200         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&e->lie_lcl_uid_hash);
00201         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&e->lie_rmt_gid_hash);
00202         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&e->lie_lcl_gid_hash);
00203         e->lie_rmt_uid = rmt_uid;
00204         e->lie_lcl_uid = lcl_uid;
00205         e->lie_rmt_gid = rmt_gid;
00206         e->lie_lcl_gid = lcl_gid;
00207 
00208         return e;
00209 }
00210 
00211 static void idmap_entry_free(struct lustre_idmap_entry *e)
00212 {
00213         list_del(&e->lie_rmt_uid_hash);
00214         list_del(&e->lie_lcl_uid_hash);
00215         list_del(&e->lie_rmt_gid_hash);
00216         list_del(&e->lie_lcl_gid_hash);
00217         OBD_FREE_PTR(e);
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*
00221  * return value
00222  * NULL: not found entry
00223  * ERR_PTR(-EACCES): found 1(remote):N(local) mapped entry
00224  * others: found normal entry
00225  */
00226 static
00227 struct lustre_idmap_entry *idmap_search_entry(struct lustre_idmap_table *t,
00228                                               uid_t rmt_uid, uid_t lcl_uid,
00229                                               gid_t rmt_gid, gid_t lcl_gid)
00230 {
00231         struct list_head *head;
00232         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00233 
00234         head = &t->lit_idmaps[RMT_UIDMAP_IDX][lustre_idmap_hashfunc(rmt_uid)];
00235         list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_rmt_uid_hash)
00236                 if (e->lie_rmt_uid == rmt_uid) {
00237                         if (e->lie_lcl_uid == lcl_uid) {
00238                                 if (e->lie_rmt_gid == rmt_gid &&
00239                                     e->lie_lcl_gid == lcl_gid)
00240                                         /* must be quaternion match */
00241                                         return e;
00242                         } else {
00243                                 /* 1:N uid mapping */
00244                                 CERROR("rmt uid %u already be mapped to %u"
00245                                        " (new %u)\n", e->lie_rmt_uid,
00246                                        e->lie_lcl_uid, lcl_uid);
00247                                 return ERR_PTR(-EACCES);
00248                         }
00249                 }
00250 
00251         head = &t->lit_idmaps[RMT_GIDMAP_IDX][lustre_idmap_hashfunc(rmt_gid)];
00252         list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_rmt_gid_hash)
00253                 if (e->lie_rmt_gid == rmt_gid) {
00254                         if (e->lie_lcl_gid == lcl_gid) {
00255                                 if (unlikely(e->lie_rmt_uid == rmt_uid &&
00256                                     e->lie_lcl_uid == lcl_uid))
00257                                         /* after uid mapping search above,
00258                                          * we should never come here */
00259                                         LBUG();
00260                         } else {
00261                                 /* 1:N gid mapping */
00262                                 CERROR("rmt gid %u already be mapped to %u"
00263                                        " (new %u)\n", e->lie_rmt_gid,
00264                                        e->lie_lcl_gid, lcl_gid);
00265                                 return ERR_PTR(-EACCES);
00266                         }
00267                 }
00268 
00269         return NULL;
00270 }
00271 
00272 static __u32 idmap_lookup_uid(struct list_head *hash, int reverse,
00273                               __u32 uid)
00274 {
00275         struct list_head *head = &hash[lustre_idmap_hashfunc(uid)];
00276         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00277 
00278         if (!reverse) {
00279                 list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_rmt_uid_hash)
00280                         if (e->lie_rmt_uid == uid)
00281                                 return e->lie_lcl_uid;
00282         } else {
00283                 list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_lcl_uid_hash)
00284                         if (e->lie_lcl_uid == uid)
00285                                 return e->lie_rmt_uid;
00286         }
00287 
00288         return CFS_IDMAP_NOTFOUND;
00289 }
00290 
00291 static __u32 idmap_lookup_gid(struct list_head *hash, int reverse, __u32 gid)
00292 {
00293         struct list_head *head = &hash[lustre_idmap_hashfunc(gid)];
00294         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00295 
00296         if (!reverse) {
00297                 list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_rmt_gid_hash)
00298                         if (e->lie_rmt_gid == gid)
00299                                 return e->lie_lcl_gid;
00300         } else {
00301                 list_for_each_entry(e, head, lie_lcl_gid_hash)
00302                         if (e->lie_lcl_gid == gid)
00303                                 return e->lie_rmt_gid;
00304         }
00305 
00306         return CFS_IDMAP_NOTFOUND;
00307 }
00308 
00309 int lustre_idmap_add(struct lustre_idmap_table *t,
00310                      uid_t ruid, uid_t luid,
00311                      gid_t rgid, gid_t lgid)
00312 {
00313         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e0, *e1;
00314 
00315         LASSERT(t);
00316 
00317         spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00318         e0 = idmap_search_entry(t, ruid, luid, rgid, lgid);
00319         spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00320         if (!e0) {
00321                 e0 = idmap_entry_alloc(ruid, luid, rgid, lgid);
00322                 if (!e0)
00323                         return -ENOMEM;
00324 
00325                 spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00326                 e1 = idmap_search_entry(t, ruid, luid, rgid, lgid);
00327                 if (e1 == NULL) {
00328                         list_add_tail(&e0->lie_rmt_uid_hash,
00329                                       &t->lit_idmaps[RMT_UIDMAP_IDX]
00330                                       [lustre_idmap_hashfunc(ruid)]);
00331                         list_add_tail(&e0->lie_lcl_uid_hash,
00332                                       &t->lit_idmaps[LCL_UIDMAP_IDX]
00333                                       [lustre_idmap_hashfunc(luid)]);
00334                         list_add_tail(&e0->lie_rmt_gid_hash,
00335                                       &t->lit_idmaps[RMT_GIDMAP_IDX]
00336                                       [lustre_idmap_hashfunc(rgid)]);
00337                         list_add_tail(&e0->lie_lcl_gid_hash,
00338                                       &t->lit_idmaps[LCL_GIDMAP_IDX]
00339                                       [lustre_idmap_hashfunc(lgid)]);
00340                 }
00341                 spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00342                 if (e1 != NULL) {
00343                         idmap_entry_free(e0);
00344                         if (IS_ERR(e1))
00345                                 return PTR_ERR(e1);
00346                 }
00347         } else if (IS_ERR(e0)) {
00348                 return PTR_ERR(e0);
00349         }
00350 
00351         return 0;
00352 }
00353 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_add);
00354 
00355 int lustre_idmap_del(struct lustre_idmap_table *t,
00356                     uid_t ruid, uid_t luid,
00357                     gid_t rgid, gid_t lgid)
00358 {
00359         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00360         int rc = 0;
00361 
00362         LASSERT(t);
00363 
00364         spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00365         e = idmap_search_entry(t, ruid, luid, rgid, lgid);
00366         if (IS_ERR(e))
00367                 rc = PTR_ERR(e);
00368         else if (e)
00369                 idmap_entry_free(e);
00370         spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00371 
00372         return rc;
00373 }
00374 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_del);
00375 
00376 int lustre_idmap_lookup_uid(struct lu_ucred *mu,
00377                             struct lustre_idmap_table *t,
00378                             int reverse, uid_t uid)
00379 {
00380         struct list_head *hash;
00381 
00382         if (mu && (mu->uc_valid == UCRED_OLD || mu->uc_valid == UCRED_NEW)) {
00383                 if (!reverse) {
00384                         if (uid == mu->uc_o_uid)
00385                                 return mu->uc_uid;
00386                         else if (uid == mu->uc_o_fsuid)
00387                                 return mu->uc_fsuid;
00388                 } else {
00389                         if (uid == mu->uc_uid)
00390                                 return mu->uc_o_uid;
00391                         else if (uid == mu->uc_fsuid)
00392                                 return mu->uc_o_fsuid;
00393                 }
00394         }
00395 
00396         if (t == NULL)
00397                 return CFS_IDMAP_NOTFOUND;
00398 
00399         hash = t->lit_idmaps[reverse ? LCL_UIDMAP_IDX : RMT_UIDMAP_IDX];
00400 
00401         spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00402         uid = idmap_lookup_uid(hash, reverse, uid);
00403         spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00404 
00405         return uid;
00406 }
00407 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_lookup_uid);
00408 
00409 int lustre_idmap_lookup_gid(struct lu_ucred *mu, struct lustre_idmap_table *t,
00410                             int reverse, gid_t gid)
00411 {
00412         struct list_head *hash;
00413 
00414         if (mu && (mu->uc_valid == UCRED_OLD || mu->uc_valid == UCRED_NEW)) {
00415                 if (!reverse) {
00416                         if (gid == mu->uc_o_gid)
00417                                 return mu->uc_gid;
00418                         else if (gid == mu->uc_o_fsgid)
00419                                 return mu->uc_fsgid;
00420                 } else {
00421                         if (gid == mu->uc_gid)
00422                                 return mu->uc_o_gid;
00423                         else if (gid == mu->uc_fsgid)
00424                                 return mu->uc_o_fsgid;
00425                 }
00426         }
00427 
00428         if (t == NULL)
00429                 return CFS_IDMAP_NOTFOUND;
00430 
00431         hash = t->lit_idmaps[reverse ? LCL_GIDMAP_IDX : RMT_GIDMAP_IDX];
00432 
00433         spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00434         gid = idmap_lookup_gid(hash, reverse, gid);
00435         spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00436 
00437         return gid;
00438 }
00439 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_lookup_gid);
00440 
00441 struct lustre_idmap_table *lustre_idmap_init(void)
00442 {
00443         struct lustre_idmap_table *t;
00444         int i, j;
00445 
00446         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(t);
00447         if(unlikely(t == NULL))
00448                 return (ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00449 
00450         spin_lock_init(&t->lit_lock);
00451         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(t->lit_idmaps); i++)
00452                 for (j = 0; j < ARRAY_SIZE(t->lit_idmaps[i]); j++)
00453                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&t->lit_idmaps[i][j]);
00454 
00455         return t;
00456 }
00457 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_init);
00458 
00459 void lustre_idmap_fini(struct lustre_idmap_table *t)
00460 {
00461         struct list_head *list;
00462         struct lustre_idmap_entry *e;
00463         int i;
00464         LASSERT(t);
00465 
00466         list = t->lit_idmaps[RMT_UIDMAP_IDX];
00467         spin_lock(&t->lit_lock);
00468         for (i = 0; i < CFS_IDMAP_HASHSIZE; i++)
00469                 while (!list_empty(&list[i])) {
00470                         e = list_entry(list[i].next,
00471                                        struct lustre_idmap_entry,
00472                                        lie_rmt_uid_hash);
00473                         idmap_entry_free(e);
00474                 }
00475         spin_unlock(&t->lit_lock);
00476 
00477         OBD_FREE_PTR(t);
00478 }
00479 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_idmap_fini);
